vulnerabilities.title: DoS vulnerability for apps with sockets enabled
vulnerabilities.description:
### Impact
In Sails apps <=v1.5.6, an attacker can send a virtual request that will cause the node process to crash. 

### Patches
This behavior was fixed in Sails [v1.5.7](https://github.com/balderdashy/sails/releases/tag/v1.5.7)

### Workarounds
Disable the sockets hook and remove the `sails.io.js` client

### References
https://github.com/balderdashy/sails/pull/7287

Big thanks to @ThomasRinsma at [Codean](https://www.linkedin.com/company/codeanio/)!

vulnerabilities.title: Prototype Pollution in Sails.js
vulnerabilities.description: Sails.js <= 1.5.2 is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution via controller/load-action-modules.js, function loadActionModules(). A [patch](https://github.com/balderdashy/sails/commit/7c5379a656bb305c958df1dcc2b51a9668830358) is available in the `master` branch of Sails.js's GItHub repository.

vulnerabilities.title: Denial of Service
vulnerabilities.description:
**Withdrawn:** Duplicate of GHSA-j95h-wmx9-4279.

Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack sending an OPTIONS request for an undefined route.
